title: Tyson Fury drops hint over Deontay Wilder rematch venue and reveals WWE finisher
text:
The Gypsy King takes on Braun Strowman on Thursday night (Picture: PA)

Tyson Fury has suggested that his long-awaited rematch with WBC heavyweight champion Deontay Wilder could take place in Saudi Arabia as he prepares to make his WWE debut in Riyadh.

The Gypsy King will face off against Braun Strowman at Crown Jewell on Thursday night as he looks to settle his feud with the giant wrestler once and for all, having already clashed on SmackDown and Raw.

Lineal champ Fury is scheduled to fight Wilder on February 22 – though it has yet to be officially announced – and the Brit has hinted that it might not be in the United States this time around.

Fury takes on Wilder in February, assuming the WBC champ beats Luis Ortiz first (Getty)

‘It’s going to be a great night of WWE, of wrestling and entertainment and hopefully this is the first time of many times that the Gypsy King comes to Saudi Arabia,’ Fury told reporters at a press event before Thursday’s show.

‘Who knows, next year, I may even fight Deontay Wilder back here in Saudi Arabia. It’s becoming a sporting hub capital of the world.’

He added: ‘I’m very excited to be here and looking forward to putting on a fantastic show tomorrow.

‘It’s a mammoth event, this has never been done before in the history of boxing or WWE. You’ve never had a current lineal world heavyweight champion fighting the biggest guy they’ve got in their roster of fighters. It’s going to be an amazing show.’

Fury has been undergoing intensive training at the WWE performance centre in Orlando and has finally revealed his signature finishing move.

Fury will be looking to debut ‘the dosser drop’ against Strowman on Thursday (Picture: Getty)

‘It’s called the dosser drop and you’re going to see it tomorrow night,’ the undefeated heavyweight confirmed.

Asked to pick his favourite ever finishing move from the many WWE superstars he’s seen in action, he still picked his own, continuing: ‘My all-time favourite move is… the dosser drop.

‘It’s an amazing move and it’s going to be an amazing experience for the Saudi Arabian people to see and witness the dosser drop, aka the Gypsy King’s finishing move.’
